content.description:
The hardest route at the slabs.  The distance to the first bolt should keep people humble.  The crux that follows requires a little bit of searching to find the right holds, and a little bit of cursing at the wet dirt inside.  There are a number of variations at the roof.  Going left requires some hard crimp pulls (5.11a), exiting right along the crack avoids some of the major difficulties encountered on the other variations (the crack has one bolt next to it but no hanger).  



This climb is located far down the left hand side of the crag, along a slightly overhanging shady section of the cliff. It may be the first climb you stumble upon if approaching from the highway pullout.

5 Bolts

The crux on this route is short and powerful.



The far left climb along the main slab.  

Bolts

This section of cliff is where the main climbing is. Except for the one steep bulgy route, everything is slab climbing. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing. It’s a great place for families, with easy access off the highway.

There are many other routes here. Maybe 8? They haven't been added to MP yet. The rest of the routes to the right of 'Salvation Army' are in the 5.5-5.9 range.
